Module org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi
Package org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi

Class AFUNIXNaming

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.AFUNIXNaming
  • public final class AFUNIXNaming
extends Object
    The AFUNIXSocket-compatible equivalent of Naming. Use this class for accessing RMI registries that are reachable by AFUNIXSockets.
    Author:
    Christian Kohlschütter

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance()
                                throws IOException
        Returns the default instance of AFUNIXNaming. Sockets are stored in java.io.tmpdir.
        Returns:
        The default instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance​(File socketDir)
                                throws RemoteException
        Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory.
        Parameters:
        socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance​(File socketDir,
                                       int registryPort)
                                throws RemoteException
        Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory. A custom "registry port" can be specified. Typically, AF-UNIX specific ports should be above 100000.
        Parameters:
        socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
        registryPort - The registry port. Should be above 100000.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • getSingleFileInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getSingleFileInstance​(File socketFile)
                                          throws IOException
        Returns an AFUNIXNaming instance which only supports one file. (Probably only useful when you want/can access the exported UnicastRemoteObject directly)
        Parameters:
        socketFile - The socket file.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the operation fails.

      • shutdownRegistry

        public void shutdownRegistry()
                      throws IOException
        Shuts this RMI Registry down. Before calling this method, you have to unexport all existing bindings, otherwise the "RMI Reaper" thread will not be closed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the operation fails.

      • createRegistry

        public Registry createRegistry()
                        throws RemoteException
        Creates a new RMI Registry.
        Returns:
        The registry
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if the operation fails.
